issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Disabled (and probably active) styling for add tag button is not correct when tags are used for ELBs and ASGs. 

They are correct in other places, like instance detail page, use that as an example of what these should look like disabled and active, please.
fields.summary: tag editor styling for disabled add button is not correct for LBs and ASGs

comments.body: Watch out for behavior when clicking the disabled button here too please.
Looking good everywhere expect create scaling group wizard something funky is happening where the add a tag block and the add another tag block are both displaying. Chrome, OSX. Screenshot attached.
Unrelated, looks like one of the guys started to integrate the new tag editor but did not finish and it made it to master.  Removed.

UX review passed for disabled button.

Something has happened with the layout of the tag editor on scaling groups that is not good. The name and value fields are different widths, and the name field is much too narrow. I fixed it so it's more presentable, but please watch out for this kind of thing in the future.

[~jloza], [~ashamblin]: In the tag editor on the scaling group details page the Add Tag button is enabled when only the tag key has an entry.  Ditto for the tag editor on the ELB details page (General tab) and the Create ELB wizard.  

The tag editor on the scaling group wizard works fine though (requires both the tag key and value to enable the button).

Since we haven't implemented GUI-1069 yet, we shouldn't allow tags with empty values in the places noted above, right?
Punting back to address validation issue when tag key is entered without value and "Add Tag" button is clicked.  Should probably disable button and perhaps style validation notice better?

Resubmitting for review, as the validation issue noted earlier (with the empty value) is due to the value field's input focus removing the ng-pristine flag, so there's not much we can do there other than style the validation error notice better (fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/commit/6fc47460a18172).
[~dkavanagh]: PR 1948 looks good to me... passing review torch to you.
commented on ticket. We can't require tag form to be valid if user isn't required to enter a tag.
[~dkavanagh]That's not what I'm seeing happening.  Can you provide steps to reproduce?

[~ashamblin], if you got to an existing scaling group detail page. The save changes button is disabled. Change a capacity field and the button remains disabled. Enter 1 character in tag name and value fields, the button becomes enabled. If you were to change the regex for those fields to allow 0 characters, the button is enabled by default. This is related to GUI-2423
